title: European Theater
description: The main theater of operations in Europe, involving the Axis and Allied powers.

title: Western Front
description: Military operations in Western Europe, including France and the Low Countries.

title: Munich Conference
description: Agreement permitting German annexation of the Sudetenland, Czechoslovakia.

title: Invasion of Poland
description: German forces invade Poland, marking the start of World War II in Europe.

title: Battle of France
description: The German invasion of France and the Low Countries, leading to the fall of Paris.

title: Dunkirk Evacuation
description: Operation Dynamo: the evacuation of Allied soldiers from the beaches of Dunkirk, France.

title: Battle of Britain
description: An intense air campaign fought over the UK between the RAF and the Luftwaffe.

title: D-Day
description: The Allied landings in Normandy, launching the liberation of Western Europe.

title: Battle of the Bulge
description: The last major German offensive campaign on the Western Front, Ardennes.

title: German Surrender
description: General Alfred Jodl signs the unconditional surrender of all German forces, Reims.

title: Eastern Front
description: The massive conflict between the Axis powers and the Soviet Union.

title: Operation Barbarossa
description: The German invasion of the Soviet Union begins, involving millions of troops.

title: Battle of Stalingrad
description: A major turning point where Soviet forces defeated the German Sixth Army.

title: Battle of Kursk
description: The largest tank battle in history, resulting in a decisive Soviet victory.

title: Battle of Berlin
description: The final major offensive of the European theater, resulting in the fall of Berlin.

title: Far East Theater
description: The conflict across East Asia, Southeast Asia, and the Pacific Ocean.

title: Pacific Ocean Front
description: Naval and island-hopping campaigns across the Pacific Ocean.

title: Pearl Harbor
description: The Japanese surprise attack on the US Naval Base in Hawaii, USA.

title: Battle of Midway
description: A crucial naval battle where the US Navy defeated the Imperial Japanese Navy.

title: Guadalcanal Campaign
description: The first major land offensive by Allied forces against Japan, Solomon Islands.

title: Battle of Leyte Gulf
description: The largest naval battle of WWII, resulting in an Allied victory in the Philippines.

title: Battle of Iwo Jima
description: A major battle in which the US Marine Corps captured the island of Iwo Jima.

title: Hiroshima Bombing
description: The first use of an atomic bomb in warfare, dropped by the United States.

title: Nagasaki Bombing
description: The second atomic bomb dropped on Japan, by the United States.

title: Japanese Surrender
description: Japan signs the formal instrument of surrender aboard the USS Missouri.

title: China Burma India Theater
description: Land operations across mainland Asia, including China and India.

title: Battle of Imphal
description: Japanese attempt to invade India, which resulted in a disastrous defeat.

title: Other Theaters
description: Operations in Africa, the Middle East, and the Mediterranean.

title: North African Campaign
description: The desert war between the Axis (Afrikakorps) and the Allies (8th Army).

title: Casablanca Conference
description: Allied strategy meeting in Casablanca, Morocco; demand for unconditional surrender.

title: Second Battle of El Alamein
description: The turning point of the Western Desert Campaign in Egypt.

title: Operation Torch
description: The British-American invasion of French North Africa (Morocco and Algeria).

title: Italian Front
description: The Allied invasion, conquest, and liberation of Italy.

title: Invasion of Sicily
description: Operation Husky: the Allied landing on the island of Sicily, Italy.

title: Battle of Monte Cassino
description: A series of four costly assaults by the Allies against the Winter Line, Italy.

title: Yalta Conference
description: The 'Big Three' meet in Crimea, USSR to plan the post-war world.

title: Potsdam Conference
description: Truman, Stalin, and Churchill/Attlee meet in Germany to finalize peace terms.

title: Invasion of Iran
description: Anglo-Soviet invasion to secure oil fields and the 'Persian Corridor'.

title: Battle of the Atlantic
description: The longest continuous naval campaign, focused on Allied supply convoys.

title: Norwegian Campaign
description: German invasion of Denmark and Norway to secure iron ore routes.

title: Sinking of the Hood
description: The German battleship Bismarck sinks the pride of the Royal Navy, Denmark Strait.

title: Sinking of the Bismarck
description: British naval and air forces sink the German battleship Bismarck, North Atlantic.

title: Wannsee Conference
description: Nazi officials meet in Berlin to coordinate the 'Final Solution'.

title: Battle of the Coral Sea
description: The first naval battle fought entirely by carrier-based aircraft.

title: Tehran Conference
description: The first meeting of Stalin, FDR, and Churchill in Iran.

title: July 20 Plot
description: An assassination attempt against Adolf Hitler by German officers, East Prussia.

title: Death of FDR
description: President Franklin D. Roosevelt dies; Harry Truman becomes US President.

title: Suicide of Hitler
description: Adolf Hitler commits suicide in his bunker in Berlin, Germany.

title: Nuremberg Trials
description: The military tribunals for the prosecution of prominent Nazi leaders, Germany.

title: Germany Declares War on US
description: Hitler declares war on the United States, following Pearl Harbor.

title: Battle of Moscow
description: Soviet defense of the capital city and the first major German retreat.

title: Siege of Leningrad
description: A brutal 872-day siege of the Soviet city by German forces.

title: Operation Bagration
description: Major Soviet offensive that destroyed the German Army Group Center.

title: Fall of Singapore
description: The surrender of the British base to Japanese forces, Southeast Asia.

title: Doolittle Raid
description: The first US air raid on Tokyo, Japan, following Pearl Harbor.

title: Battle of the Philippine Sea
description: A massive naval air battle known as the 'Great Marianas Turkey Shoot'.

title: Battle of Okinawa
description: The largest amphibious assault in the Pacific theater, near Japan.

title: Nanking Massacre
description: Widespread atrocities committed by Japanese forces in Nanking, China.

title: Siege of Tobruk
description: Allied defense of the Libyan port city against the Afrikakorps.

title: Battle of Anzio
description: Allied landing behind German lines near Rome, Italy.

title: Liberation of Rome
description: Allied forces enter Rome after months of stalemate in Italy.

title: Battle of the River Plate
description: The first naval battle of the war, off the coast of Uruguay.

title: Atlantic Charter
description: Policy statement issued by Churchill and FDR setting post-war goals.

title: Bretton Woods Conference
description: Establishment of the post-war financial system, New Hampshire, USA.

title: UN Charter Signed
description: Establishment of the United Nations, San Francisco, USA.

title: Trinity Test
description: The first successful detonation of a nuclear weapon, New Mexico, USA.

title: The Manhattan Project
description: The top-secret development of the atomic bomb in the United States.

title: The Winter War
description: Conflict between the Soviet Union and Finland over territory.

title: Invasion of Burma
description: Japanese forces seize Burma to cut the Allied supply route to China.

title: Liberation of Auschwitz
description: Soviet forces discover and liberate the Nazi death camp in Poland.

title: The Blitz
description: Sustained strategic bombing of London and other British cities.

title: Liberation of Paris
description: Allied and Free French forces reclaim the capital of France.

title: Operation Market Garden
description: Failed Allied paratrooper operation to capture bridges in the Netherlands.

title: Battle of Bataan
description: The defense and subsequent fall of the Bataan Peninsula, Philippines.

title: Bataan Death March
description: Forced march of US and Filipino POWs after the surrender of Bataan.

title: Italy Declares War
description: Mussolini declares war on Britain and France, joining the Axis.

title: Italian Armistice
description: The Kingdom of Italy signs a secret armistice with Allied powers.

title: Syria-Lebanon Campaign
description: Allied invasion to prevent Vichy French territory from being used by Axis.

title: Battle of Crete
description: The first primarily airborne invasion in history, by German paratroopers.

title: V-J Day
description: Japan announces surrender, effectively ending World War II hostilities.
